channel.title: linux on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Linux on the in-flight system
item.description: 13:06 Friday 06 October 2017 JST My inflight entertainment system rebooted itself and I got a few pics of the logs. Looks like it’s running X Window on Linux. Seems reasonable. Weird that mine rebooted while it seems none of the others did. Do we each have our own virtual server?

item.title: might be able to run os x on Linux
item.description: 00:47 Saturday 12 November 2016 JST https://techsviewer.com/how-to-install-mac-os-x-el-capitan-on-pc-on-virtualbox/ summary: OS X 10.11 Image: Google Drive (One Full): https://goo.gl/lWQRew Google Drive (7 of 7 Part): https://goo.gl/cHWXrx Fix Download Limit: https://techsviewer.com/fix-download-limit Torren.t: https://goo.gl/WH5bWc

item.title: yay linux
item.description: 18:36 Wednesday 2 June 1999 Yay! After pretty much working on it all day, I got my linux box up and running ppp, I downloaded netscape, installed it, created user accounts for myself and Wende, and all is great!! I’ve even customized things a bit more this time around (as opposed to last time I had linux on my machine) making it easier to set up new accounts and stuff. I’m happy.

item.title: linux again
item.description: Thursday 27 May 1999 Back some months (year?) ago, I worked on installing Linux and Windows on one machine. I had big problems at first with Windows trying to be the main boot manager, but finally was able to get it to all work in relative harmony. When I installed Windows 98 on the same machine, intending for it to replace only the Windows 95 partition, tragedy struck, I lost Linux accessibility altogether, and Win98 was unstable like anything, so I started from scratch again.

item.title: linux grr
item.description: 27 May 1999 The machine I wanted to convert to linux, apparently, for no apparent reason, has broken. It was so cute - Win 95 with almost no drivers, almost nothing on the disk.. I copied to floppies a couple of files that I wanted to keep, and I was ready to install linux. Taking an inventory of the machine, I booted it a couple times to see what chipset was on the video card.
